macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: US Markets Show Mixed Gains on First Trading Day of 2026
items.summary: The S&P 500 rose 0.2% to 6,858.47, Dow gained 0.7% to 48,382.39, while Nasdaq dipped less than 0.1% to 23,235.63 amid tech sector volatility. Nvidia climbed 1.3%, but Microsoft and Tesla fell 2.2% and 2.6% respectively after Tesla's reported sales decline.

items.title: Global Markets Closed on January 4 Holiday with No Major Economic Data
items.summary: US and European exchanges remained closed for New Year's holiday, resulting in low trading activity and no new macroeconomic publications or corporate reports. Investors are preparing for upcoming data from China and the first full trading week.

items.title: FOMC Minutes Reveal Closer Rate Cut Decision, Slight Hawkish Tilt
items.summary: Recent FOMC meeting minutes indicated the December rate cut decision was closer than expected, introducing a hawkish nuance to 2026 expectations with markets pricing only two cuts. US Dollar Index showed bullish signs amid this outlook.

items.title: S&P 500 Faces Moderate Reversal After Record Highs
items.summary: Following a 16% gain in 2025, the S&P 500 exhibited a textbook moderate reversal pattern last week, driven partly by precious metals selloff, with new highs still possible above 6,940.

items.title: Fed Policy Seen as Wall Street's Key Risk for 2026 Over Tariffs
items.summary: After strong 2025 gains (S&P 500 +16%, Dow +13%, Nasdaq +20%), analysts highlight Federal Reserve actions as the primary market risk in 2026 rather than tariffs.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Surges Above $91,000 Amid Geopolitical Tensions
items.summary: Bitcoin rose above $91,000 on January 4, 2026, driven by Venezuela geopolitical tensions and $2.5B in whale/exchange buying activity. The cryptocurrency traded between $89,665 and $91,810 over the past 24 hours, up 1.70% as of 09:30 AM UTC.

items.title: Crypto Market Cap Exceeds $3 Trillion
items.summary: The global cryptocurrency market cap reached $3.06 trillion, up 1.44% over the last day. Ethereum climbed above $3,150 while altcoins like Solana and XRP posted double-digit weekly gains.

items.title: Memecoins Lead Market Rally with Significant Gains
items.summary: BONK surged 31%, CVX jumped 27%, and RENDER climbed 20% as top gainers. Dogecoin and PEPE also posted gains of up to 25% as 2026 opened with a meme coin surge.

items.title: XRP Jumps 8% Above $2 on SEC Sentiment Shift
items.summary: XRP surged 8% above $2 as traders bet on a friendlier regulatory environment with the SEC. The altcoin was among the major gainers in the broader market rally.

items.title: Solana Plans Major Upgrade with Alpenglow for Enhanced Consensus
items.summary: Solana announced plans for a major upgrade called Alpenglow designed to enhance its consensus mechanism, marking a significant development for the blockchain platform.

items.title: Turkmenistan Legalizes Crypto Mining and Exchanges
items.summary: Turkmenistan has legalized cryptocurrency mining and exchanges to boost economic growth, representing a significant regulatory development in Central Asia.

items.title: U.S. Cryptocurrency Spot ETF Trading Volume Surpasses $2 Trillion
items.summary: U.S. cryptocurrency spot ETF trading volume has exceeded $2 trillion, reflecting growing institutional adoption and mainstream acceptance of digital assets.

items.title: Neobanks to Fuel Ethereum's 2026 Growth
items.summary: According to ether.fi CEO, neobanks are expected to drive Ethereum's growth throughout 2026, highlighting the platform's expanding role in financial services.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: AI Sector Undergoes Fundamental Realignment in 2026 as Reliability Concerns Mount
items.summary: The artificial intelligence industry is shifting focus from expanding large models to optimizing existing ones through post-training techniques. A critical finding shows that advanced reasoning models like DeepSeek's R1 exhibit high hallucination rates on simple tasks, revealing a fundamental trade-off between capability and reliability that can no longer be ignored.

items.title: Enterprise Focus Shifts from Chatbots to Autonomous AI Agents
items.summary: Business buyers are moving away from conversational assistants toward autonomous workflow automation and AI agents capable of independent action and self-correction, recognizing these systems promise genuine productivity gains that chatbots have failed to deliver.

items.title: Quantum Computing and AI Integration Reaching Practical Maturity
items.summary: Quantum processors coupled with AI-managed error correction are beginning to demonstrate practical advantages in financial risk optimization, drug discovery, and materials science—problem classes where quantum advantage has been theoretically plausible but is now becoming practically achievable.

items.title: Google DeepMind Advances World Models for Embodied AI and Robotics
items.summary: Google is developing interactive world models and synthetic training environments to advance embodied AI applications including robots and self-driving cars, with researchers highlighting the potential for AI agents to experience accelerated training timelines in virtual simulations.

items.title: AI Safety Concerns Intensify Among Industry Leaders
items.summary: AI pioneer Yoshua Bengio reports struggling with sleep due to concerns about the future of artificial intelligence, reflecting broader expert warnings about pending existential threats in the field.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Tech Billionaires Cash Out $16 Billion in 2025 Amid Soaring Stocks
items.summary: Tech billionaires sold $16 billion worth of shares in 2025 as stock prices reached record highs. This reflects significant profit-taking in the tech sector.

items.title: Meta Quest 3S VR Headset Discounted $50 with $50 Gift Card
items.summary: Meta's Quest 3S, normally $299.99, is available for $249.99 and includes a $50 Amazon digital credit. The deal remains active post-holidays.

items.title: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to Keynote CES 2026 on January 5
items.summary: CES 2026 kicks off in Las Vegas with Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's keynote, focusing on tech outlook including physical AI, robots, and self-driving cars. Wall Street anticipates announcements amid 2026 stock predictions.

items.title: Bitfinex Hacker Ilya Lichtenstein Released Early from Prison
items.summary: Ilya Lichtenstein, convicted in the Bitfinex crypto exchange hack and money laundering, credits Trump for his early prison release. The news broke on January 3.

items.title: Trader Profits Big Betting on Maduro's Capture via Polymarket
items.summary: An account on prediction market Polymarket made suspicious large bets just before the US captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro. Bets on removal by January 31 were as low as $0.07.
